[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Zero-Knowledge Property] Does the verification process preserve zero-knowledge, or can verifiers extract partial information about validator secrets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Batch Verification Soundness] Does batching preserve the soundness of individual PoK verification, or can invalid proofs hide behind valid ones in the batch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Tau Bias] If tau is derived from biased randomness or predictable sources, can attackers pre-compute valid PoKs or find collisions in the batch verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Tau Power Overflow] The comment at line 75 mentions using powers of tau - can computing tau^i for large i cause scalar overflow or loss of precision? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Tau Reuse] Can the same tau value be safely reused for multiple batch verifications, or does reuse enable cross-batch attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Tau Inversion] If tau is invertible in the field, can computing tau^(-1) enable verification bypass or forge attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Struct: Contribution] [BCS Encoding Ambiguity] Can two different Contribution instances have the same BCS encoding due to ambiguous length prefixes or type encoding? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Struct: Contribution] [Hash Function Collision] Does CryptoHasher use a collision-resistant hash function, or can attackers find colliding Contribution structs with 2^128 effort? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Struct: Contribution] [Serialization Ordering] If the Contribution struct fields are serialized in a different order than declared, can this cause signature verification to pass for tampered data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Struct: Contribution] [Deserialization Validation] When deserializing Contribution instances, are group elements validated to be on the curve before use? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Player ID Forgery] The Player struct at line 22 contains only an ID field - can attackers forge contributions with arbitrary Player IDs if validation is missing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Player ID Range] Are Player IDs validated to be within the range [0, n-1] for n validators, or can out-of-range IDs cause array out-of-bounds access in calling code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Player ID Uniqueness] Does the verification check that each Player ID appears at most once in the soks array, preventing Sybil attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Player ID Mapping] Can Player IDs be mapped to wrong public keys in the spks array due to index misalignment, causing attribution errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Aux Data Type Safety] The auxiliary data type A is generic and unconstrained - can type confusion allow injecting malicious data that affects transcript semantics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Aux Data Size] Can extremely large auxiliary data objects cause memory exhaustion during cloning and serialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Aux Data Manipulation] Since aux is signed but not cryptographically committed in the PoK, can it be modified after PoK generation while maintaining valid signatures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Aux Data Serialization] If auxiliary data serialization is non-deterministic, can this cause signature verification failures for valid contributions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Group Type Mismatch] The function is generic over Gr - can callers instantiate it with different group types (G1 vs G2) causing type confusion in pairing operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Trait Bound Insufficient] The Gr type requires Display, Copy, Group, Mul<&Scalar> traits - are these sufficient to prevent malicious trait implementations that break cryptographic security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Lifetime Constraints] The function has complex lifetime bounds with for<'a> Mul<&'a Scalar> - can lifetime parameter manipulation cause dangling references? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Struct: Contribution] [Generic Type Substitution] Can malicious code substitute the Gr or A type parameters with types that have different security properties but still satisfy trait bounds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Quantum Attack Surface] The Schnorr PoK and BLS signatures are based on discrete log - can quantum adversaries with Shor's algorithm break the DKG protocol by computing discrete logs? (Low - Long-term)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Post-Quantum Migration] If Aptos migrates to post-quantum cryptography, can old DKG transcripts with this classical crypto be replayed to break new quantum-resistant protocols? (Low - Long-term)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/contribution.rs] [Function: batch_verify_soks()] [Verification Complexity] The batch verification has O(n) group operations for n validators - can attackers force verification of extremely large batches (>10,000) to DoS the protocol? (Medium)
